intro: Peucedanum officinale subsp. paniculatum, commonly known as greater cow-weed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features slender, branched stems that grow up to 1 meter in height, often with a hairy texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks.
